meanings.definition: To bring out of a state of sleep, unconsciousness, inactivity, or indifference.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise rouses the sleeping cat from its nap.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock rouses me from my deep slumber every morning.
meanings.sent3: The smell of bacon cooking rouses even the sleepiest person in the house.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news rouses excitement in the usually quiet town.
meanings.sent5: The bright sunlight streaming through the window rouses me gently from my sleep.

meanings.sent1: The thrilling movie rouses emotions in the audience.
meanings.sent2: The passionate speech rouses the crowd to action.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rouses laughter with its antics.
meanings.sent4: The music rouses memories of happy times long ago.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh-baked cookies rouses a sense of nostalgia in me.
